body_html:
A fresh build on a separate machine did not fix my PDB errors.

On a whim, I tried enabling Cuda support on the second machine, and I got a different set of errors, starting with:
Severity Code Description Project File Line Suppression State
Error MSB6006 "cmd.exe" exited with code 1. tf_core_gpu_kernels C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V140\Microsoft.CppCommon.targets 171

And followed by a bunch of errors related to tf_core_gpu_kernels not existing. Any ideas about this one?

Also, @mrry you said that RelWithDebInfo builds fine for you, right? Do you use Visual Studio or do you use MSBuild like in the instructions? Thanks.

And followed by a bunch of errors related to tf_core_gpu_kernels not existing. Any ideas about this one?
Also, @mrry you said that RelWithDebInfo builds fine for you, right? Do you use Visual Studio or do you use MSBuild like in the instructions? Thanks.
body:
A fresh build on a separate machine did not fix my PDB errors.

On a whim, I tried enabling Cuda support on the second machine, and I got a different set of errors, starting with: 
Severity	Code	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
Error	MSB6006	"cmd.exe" exited with code 1.	tf_core_gpu_kernels	C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V140\Microsoft.CppCommon.targets	171	

And followed by a bunch of errors related to tf_core_gpu_kernels not existing. Any ideas about this one?

Also, @mrry you said that RelWithDebInfo builds fine for you, right? Do you use Visual Studio or do you use MSBuild like in the instructions? Thanks.
